Class BuilderDAO

java.lang.Object
com.builderportfolio.dao.BuilderDAO
public class BuilderDAO extends Object
DAO class for managing Builder data.

This class maintains an in-memory mapping between builder IDs and their assigned project IDs. Supports operations for creating builders, adding/removing projects, and querying builder data. Thread-safe collections are used for concurrent access.

  • Constructor Details

    • BuilderDAO

      public BuilderDAO()

  • Method Details

    • createBuilder

      public static void createBuilder(String builderId)
      Creates a new builder entry when a builder registers. Initially, the builder has no projects assigned.
      Parameters:
      builderId - ID of the builder to create

    • addProjectToBuilder

      public static void addProjectToBuilder(String builderId, Long projectId)
      Adds a project ID to the builder's project list. If the builder does not exist, a new entry is created automatically.
      Parameters:
      builderId - ID of the builder
      projectId - ID of the project to assign
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if builderId or projectId is null

    • getProjectIds

      public static List<Long> getProjectIds(String builderId)
      Returns all project IDs assigned to a builder.
      Parameters:
      builderId - ID of the builder
      Returns:
      List of project IDs assigned to the builder; empty list if none exist

    • removeProjectFromBuilder

      public static void removeProjectFromBuilder(String builderId, long projectId)
      Removes a project from a builder's project list when the project is deleted.
      Parameters:
      builderId - ID of the builder
      projectId - ID of the project to remove

    • builderExists

      public static boolean builderExists(String builderId)
      Checks whether a builder exists in the system.
      Parameters:
      builderId - ID of the builder to check
      Returns:
      true if the builder exists, false otherwise

    • clear

      public static void clear()
      Clears all builder data from the system. Useful for resetting in-memory storage during tests.
